summary.p: The MetadataContext class represents a provider for meta information such as how to compare certain types and what properties and methods a type has.

section.title: Sharing
section.p: The MetadataContext can be shared across multiple different DataContexts. Thefore, it can also be shared across multiple different queries and expressions.

section.title: Elements in a Metadata Context
section.p: A MetadataContext may contain different items. The following table lists all of them.

tr.td: A property provider specifies which properties a type has. See Custom Properties for details how to use them.
A method provider specifies which methods a type has. See Custom Methods for details how to use them.
A comparer specifies how instances of a type should be compared. See Custom Comparers for details how to use them.
